Text: Good morning, George. You've worked hard.
I brought little Emily here. I wonder how our patient is doing now?
Hey, good morning, my dear (username), and lovely Emily.
(beep) (happy expression)
I've been observing Andrew's condition, and there have been some changes recently.
I see, can you tell me some details?
Good job, George.
Ah, you know, his condition has always been quite uncertain.
Sometimes it's good, sometimes it's not so good. Just like getting up every morning, you're always unsure what kind of day it will be.
Emily suspects you're alluding to your own condition.
(pause) Ehe.
But to be honest, Andrew's condition is indeed worrying.
I'll do my best to observe.
Very good, we have to go see him as soon as possible and find out the details.
Haha, otherwise George, you should work harder, so we don't have to worry.
Emily agrees (username).
You two can evaluate Mr. Andrew's condition by talking to him and running some tests.
At the same time, Emily can analyze the monitoring data to see if there are any unusual patterns or trends.
Yes, maybe we can find some solutions based on the conversation.
It sounds like a perfect solution.
But I must remind you that Andrew's situation may not be as optimistic as you two think.
Like I said, it's very uncertain, sometimes good and sometimes bad.
Maybe we were chatting well in the last second, and we have to introduce ourselves again in the next second.
Based on what you said before, even in a joking tone, it's not such a serious situation.
My bad, Emily.
Okay, you two stop making trouble.
We should go to Andrew's ward.
Yes, dear. Let's go to the front desk to get the medical records and room keys.
In order to prevent Andrew from disappearing suddenly, we decided to lock the door and windows of the ward.
Correction: Humans cannot disappear out of thin air, it is recommended to change to missing.
... Emily, you are getting less and less cute.
Anyway, let's go to the front desk to get the medical records and room keys.
